title: Calories in Chicken Hearts
meta_description: Discover calories in chicken hearts per 100 g, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Cooked (boiled or simmered), raw hearts trimmed of fat; no added salt, oil, or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by source, cooking method, portion size, and added ingredients. Consult labels or databases for precision.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of cooked chicken hearts provides about 185 kcal and 26 g protein.

label_note: Values align with standard Nutrition Facts format for straightforward comparison.

tweaks.label: Grilled with 1 tsp oil per 100 g
Add salt and spices (minimal calorie impact)

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g chicken hearts?
faqs.a: Approximately 185 kcal for cooked chicken hearts.

faqs.q: Are chicken hearts high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, about 26 g protein per 100 g, making them a lean source.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in chicken hearts?
faqs.a: Around 8.5 g total fat per 100 g, with 2.5 g saturated.
Negligible, only 0.1 g carbs and 0 g fiber per 100 g.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in chicken hearts?
faqs.a: Cooking concentrates nutrients; raw is slightly lower at ~165 kcal per 100 g.
